messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] oops
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/5/2000 10:40:36 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... I read the right word where there is a typo.  Of course, I have lousy handwriting myself.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/5/2000 10:40:36 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
lurine@... writes:

> O.K., is it just me and more years of working legal and medical professions
> where folks have THE worst handwriting in the world and you just get to the
> point where you can "read" what they meant and not necessarily what they
> wrote or does everyone usually "read" the right word into the typo space?
>
> Lynda, who doesn't even notice most typos anymore <g>

I 'read' the right word where there is a typo. Of course, I have lousy
handwriting myself. No one even dares to attempt to interpret what I write.
My goal is to one day be a pharmacist. I figure with all the practice I have
deciphering my own handwriting, I ought to be really good at reading the
doc's writing and can get paid decent to boot!

(Of course that was pre-Fibromyalgia [or whatever I've really got]. At this
rate, I'll be lucky if I ever get to go back to college! But that's another
story.)

Eiraul

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] oops
messages.msgSnippet: O.K., is it just me and more years of working legal and medical professions where folks have THE worst handwriting in the world and you just get to the point
messages.messageBody:
O.K., is it just me and more years of working legal and medical professions
where folks have THE worst handwriting in the world and you just get to the
point where you can "read" what they meant and not necessarily what they
wrote or does everyone usually "read" the right word into the typo space?

Lynda, who doesn't even notice most typos anymore <g>
